intro: Heteropterys metallochroa, commonly known as the silverleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has palmate leaves with a silvery underside, which gives it its common name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, and the plant produces capsules containing numerous seeds.
